page.title: 03Vist to Veddoes Farm (cont.)
page.content: Mr. Barrell usually buys three hundred tons of silage for his cattle in winter. The cows are milked at 6.45 a.m. and at 4.30 p.m. He does not employ anyone else but his wife and two sons help out regularly. He has two barns and a wide range of equipment. He has a crop sprayer which he rarely uses as he is a keen naturalist. He has three tractors and a generator for milking. He rotates his potatoes and turnips every year and has Hereford and Fresian cattle. The farmhouse was built in 1936 and has seven rooms. He has two computers, a Land Rover and a car.
